name: Peb Fort (Vikatgad)
description: Peb Fort, also known as Vikatgad, is a scenic hill fort near Matheran. The trail passes through lush forest, rocky patches, and features a thrilling ladder climb near the top. It offers views of Neral, Matheran hill station, and nearby Sahyadri ranges.

startingPoint.name: Neral (Anandwadi)
startingPoint.description: Neral is well connected via local trains from Mumbai and Pune. Anandwadi is a 15–20 min walk from Neral station and serves as the entry point to the trail.

networkAvailability.emergencyContact: Pre-trek notification advised. Dial 108/112 in case of network availability. No dedicated medical/rescue post on trek.

foodAccommodation.foodOnTrek: No food stalls mid-trek. Tea and snacks available in Neral only. Carry packed meals.
foodAccommodation.waterSources: Small streams during monsoon; unreliable during dry season. Carry 2L minimum.
foodAccommodation.campingOptions: Allowed near Anandwadi fields or summit cave with sleeping bags. No official campsites.

trail: Start from Anandwadi village near Neral.
Walk along toy train track from marker 134 NM → 155 NM.
Turn into forest trail after marker 155.
Rocky climb with exposed ridge walk.
Reach iron ladder and climb to summit plateau.
Explore caves, Datta temple, and flagpole.
alternativeRoutes: From Matheran via Sunset Point ridge (longer)
seasonalNotes: Monsoon: lush & slippery, Summer: dry but hot, Winter: best for clear views

permitInfo.howToApply: No permit needed for individuals or groups.
permitInfo.timingRestrictions: Avoid after sunset. Local police may stop overnight campers during monsoon.
